Sitting in India, which is
for maybe half the population

Getting the market to work for

has, I think, proven

And you have the

Is that a statement that

Or is that overstating it?

RATAN NAVAL TATA:
My own assessment

is that the market is very
demanding of such products.

It's a very sensitive
market, in the sense

if you have a calamity, you
can't give secondhand clothing,
or yesterday's food.

No one wants to be
seen or categorized
as getting a handout.

So whatever one
does, one mistake

that one makes of trying to
show that we are doing it

for the person who can't
afford to get something else
is the wrong approach.

You can get the
price there, but you

have to market the
product as being just as
good as everything else.

The [INAUDIBLE] should
have been viewed

as something that could
be in a garage that

has a Bentley on the
one hand, and then
another to go to the market.

And that's something
that someone

who couldn't afford a car
can now afford to get a car.
That's
[INTERPOSING VOICES]
the mistake we made.

So I think the
base of the pyramid

is keen to have its own place
and status in the hierarchy

of the consuming public,
which one needs to respect
more than we have been.
[INTERPOSING VOICES]
--than we have been doing.
